sentence.Network_en: From even this stronghold the unlucky Rip was at length routed by his termagant wife.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使在这样的堡垒里,不幸的瑞普到底还是被他那凶悍的老婆赶出来了.

sentence.Network_en: A termagant wife may, in some respects, be considered a tolerable blessing.
sentence.Network_cn: 从某些方面来说, 有一个泼辣的妻子,也可以看作是相当有福气的.

sentence.Network_en: A termagant wife may, therefore, in some respects, be considered a tolerable blessing.
sentence.Network_cn: 因此, 从某些方面来说, 有个泼辣的妻子,也可以看作是相当有福气的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 2): via Old French from Italian Trivagante, taken to be from Latin tri- 'three' + vagant- 'wandering', and to refer to the moon ‘wandering’ between heaven, earth, and hell under the three names Selene, Artemis, and Persephone
